definitions: person who is from or has ancestry from the Asian continent
characteristic, quality, or feature that relates to or originates from Asia
examples: The conference featured several Asiatic scholars presenting their research
Many Asiatic communities have settled in this diverse neighborhood
The museum displayed beautiful Asiatic art from various dynasties
Traditional Asiatic philosophies emphasize harmony and balance in life

definitions: violent physical attack intended to harm or injure another person
criminal offense involving physical violence or threat of violence against another
military operation involving concentrated attack on enemy positions or objectives
examples: The victim survived the brutal assault outside the nightclub
Security cameras captured the assault in the parking garage
He was charged with assault after the bar fight
The prosecutor presented evidence of aggravated assault to the jury
The military planned a dawn assault on the enemy stronghold
Naval forces began their assault on the coastal fortifications

definitions: belief or idea accepted as true without proof or verification
act of taking on responsibility, power, or position of authority
Christian celebration of Virgin Mary's bodily ascent into heaven
examples: Your assumption about the project timeline proved completely wrong
We shouldn't make assumptions without examining all the evidence
His assumption of the CEO role brought significant changes
The assumption of power by the new government proceeded smoothly
Catholics celebrate the Assumption of Mary every August fifteenth
The cathedral holds special mass for the feast of the Assumption

definitions: major city and capital of the state of Georgia in southeastern United States
Greek mythological huntress known for her speed and hunting prowess
examples: Atlanta hosts the world's busiest airport by passenger traffic
The company relocated its headquarters to downtown Atlanta last year
The story of Atlanta and the golden apples appears in Greek mythology
Atlanta refused to marry anyone who couldn't defeat her in a footrace

definitions: second largest ocean separating the Americas from Europe and Africa
relating to or bordering the Atlantic Ocean or its coastal regions
examples: Ships cross the Atlantic carrying cargo between continents daily
The Atlantic stretches from the Arctic to the Antarctic oceans
Atlantic storms often affect the eastern United States coastline
The Atlantic provinces of Canada include Nova Scotia and Newfoundland

definitions: space or room directly below the roof of a house used for storage
relating to ancient Athens or classical Greek architectural style
ancient Greek dialect spoken in Athens and surrounding Attica region
examples: We store Christmas decorations in the attic above the garage
The attic conversion created two additional bedrooms for the family
The museum features beautiful Attic pottery from ancient Greece
Attic columns display characteristic elegance and refined proportions
Scholars study Attic Greek to read classical philosophical texts
Most ancient Greek literature was written in the Attic dialect

definitions: largest city in New Zealand located on the North Island with major harbor
examples: Auckland attracts thousands of international students to its universities annually
The Auckland Harbor Bridge connects the city center to North Shore
The Auckland Airport serves as New Zealand's primary international gateway
Many sailing enthusiasts visit Auckland, known as the City of Sails

definitions: abbreviated form of August, the eighth month of the year
examples: The conference is scheduled for Aug 15-17 this year
Please submit your report by Aug 31 at the latest
School registration begins Aug 1 for all new students
The Aug edition of the magazine features summer travel destinations

definitions: eighth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar with thirty-one days
inspiring reverence or admiration through dignity, impressiveness, or grandeur
examples: August temperatures often reach their yearly peak in many regions
Many Europeans take their summer vacations during August
The august presence of the Supreme Court justices commanded respect
She delivered her speech with august dignity befitting the occasion

definitions: natural light display in polar skies caused by solar particles interacting with atmosphere
Roman goddess of dawn who renews herself each morning
name of various cities particularly in Colorado and Illinois United States
examples: The aurora borealis painted brilliant green curtains across the Arctic sky
Scientists study aurora patterns to understand solar wind interactions
Ancient Romans believed Aurora opened heaven's gates each morning
Aurora's tears became the morning dew according to mythology
Aurora, Colorado experienced rapid population growth in recent decades
The Aurora city council approved the new development project yesterday

definitions: largest Nazi concentration and extermination camp complex located in occupied Poland during World War II
examples: Auschwitz stands as a memorial to Holocaust victims and survivors
Over one million people were murdered at Auschwitz during the Holocaust
The Auschwitz museum preserves evidence of Nazi atrocities for education
Survivors of Auschwitz testified about the horrors they witnessed there

definitions: informal term for a person from Australia or of Australian origin
relating to or characteristic of Australia or its people and culture
examples: The Aussie backpackers shared stories from their travels around Europe
Several Aussie athletes competed in the international swimming championships
The restaurant serves authentic Aussie meat pies and lamingtons
His Aussie accent became stronger after visiting family in Sydney

definitions: capital city of Texas known for technology industry and music scene
common English surname and given name of Anglo-Saxon origin
examples: Austin hosts the famous South by Southwest festival every spring
Many tech companies have relocated their operations to Austin recently
Austin Powers became a popular comedy character in the late nineties
Judge Austin presided over the high-profile corporate fraud case

definitions: region comprising Australia, New Zealand, and neighboring Pacific islands including New Guinea
examples: Many unique marsupials evolved in isolation throughout Australasia
The company expanded its operations across the entire Australasia region
Australasia contains some of the world's most diverse coral reef systems
Trade agreements strengthen economic ties between Australasia nations

definitions: island continent and country in the Southern Hemisphere comprising mainland and Tasmania
examples: Australia contains unique wildlife found nowhere else on Earth
Mining contributes significantly to Australia's export economy
Indigenous peoples inhabited Australia for over sixty thousand years
The Great Barrier Reef extends along Australia's northeastern coast

definitions: person who is from or citizen of the Commonwealth of Australia
relating to or characteristic of Australia, its people, or culture
examples: The Australian scientist won the Nobel Prize for medical research
Many Australians enjoy outdoor activities like surfing and bushwalking
Australian wines have gained international recognition for their quality
The museum features an extensive collection of Australian Aboriginal art

definitions: landlocked country in Central Europe bordered by Germany, Czech Republic, and Italy
examples: Austria attracts millions of tourists to its Alpine ski resorts annually
Vienna serves as Austria's capital and largest city
Classical music flourished in Austria during the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries
Austria joined the European Union in nineteen ninety-five

definitions: person who is from or citizen of the Republic of Austria
relating to Austria, its people, culture, or language
examples: The Austrian composer Mozart created timeless classical masterpieces
Many Austrian citizens speak both German and English fluently
Austrian cuisine features dishes like Wiener Schnitzel and Sachertorte
The Austrian Alps offer spectacular skiing and hiking opportunities

definitions: ancient Indian system of medicine based on natural healing using herbs, diet, and yogic breathing
examples: Ayurveda practitioners assess patients through pulse diagnosis and observation
Many people seek Ayurveda treatments for chronic health conditions
The Ayurveda clinic offers personalized herbal remedies and dietary guidance
Traditional Ayurveda emphasizes balance among body, mind, and consciousness

definitions: country in the South Caucasus region bordered by Russia, Georgia, Armenia, and Iran
examples: Azerbaijan exports significant quantities of oil through the Caspian Sea
Baku serves as Azerbaijan's capital and economic center
Azerbaijan gained independence from the Soviet Union in nineteen ninety-one
The Azerbaijan Grand Prix attracts Formula One fans from around the world

definitions: person who is from or citizen of the Republic of Azerbaijan
Turkic language spoken primarily in Azerbaijan and northwestern Iran
examples: The Azerbaijani delegation presented their proposal at the conference
Many Azerbaijani families celebrate Novruz as their new year festival
She studied Azerbaijani to communicate with her husband's relatives
Azerbaijani uses a modified Latin alphabet since independence

definitions: member of the Turkic ethnic group native to Azerbaijan and Iran
variety of Azerbaijani language spoken by Azeri people
examples: The Azeri population in Iran numbers several million people
Azeri merchants have traded along the Silk Road for centuries
He speaks fluent Azeri with his grandparents at home
Azeri literature includes both oral traditions and written works

definitions: member of the indigenous people who dominated central Mexico before Spanish conquest
relating to the Aztec civilization, culture, language, or empire
examples: The Aztec empire controlled much of Mesoamerica in the fifteenth century
Spanish conquistadors encountered the Aztec civilization in fifteen nineteen
The museum displays magnificent Aztec gold artifacts and stone carvings
Aztec mythology influenced art and architecture throughout their empire

definitions: official or legal prohibition against something or someone
formal public condemnation or curse pronounced by religious authority
examples: The government imposed a ban on single-use plastic bags
The smoking ban in restaurants improved air quality significantly
The medieval church issued a ban against the heretical teachings
The papal ban excommunicated the rebellious nobles from the church

definitions: establishment serving alcoholic beverages for consumption on the premises
solid piece of material longer than it is wide
legal profession or qualifying examination for practicing law
unit of atmospheric pressure equal to 100,000 pascals
barrier or obstacle that prevents movement or progress
metrical unit in music notation containing specified number of beats
examples: The sports bar was packed with fans watching the championship game
They met at a quiet bar to discuss the business proposal
She used a metal bar to pry open the stuck window
The chocolate bar melted in the hot car
After passing the bar exam, she joined a prestigious law firm
Members of the bar association attended the judicial conference
The weather station recorded atmospheric pressure at 1.2 bars
Deep sea divers experience pressure of several bars underwater
Iron bars prevented the prisoners from escaping their cells
Language barriers create bars to international business communication
The song repeats the same four bars throughout the chorus
The composer wrote sixteen bars of introduction before the melody

definitions: fundamental principle, element, or skill forming the foundation of something
computer programming language designed for beginners with simple English-like commands
examples: Students must master the basics of algebra before advancing
The training covers all basics of customer service excellence
Many programmers learned BASIC as their first computer language
The old computer still runs programs written in BASIC

definitions: container used for storing or disposing of waste or materials
range of values grouped together in data analysis or computing
examples: Please put the recycling in the blue bin by the garage
The storage bin contains winter clothes and extra blankets
The histogram displays data sorted into bins of ten units each
The algorithm assigns values to appropriate bins for processing

definitions: sandwich made with bacon, lettuce, and tomato, typically served on toasted bread
examples: The diner serves the best BLT sandwich in town
She ordered a BLT with extra bacon for lunch
The restaurant adds avocado to their signature BLT sandwich
A classic BLT requires crispy bacon and fresh tomatoes

definitions: body mass index calculated from weight and height to assess if weight is healthy
examples: The doctor calculated her BMI to determine appropriate weight goals
A BMI over thirty indicates obesity according to medical guidelines
Insurance companies sometimes use BMI to assess health risks
Athletes may have high BMI due to muscle mass, not fat

definitions: British thermal unit measuring amount of heat energy needed to raise temperature of one pound of water by one degree Fahrenheit
examples: The air conditioner has a cooling capacity of 12,000 BTUs
Natural gas bills show consumption measured in BTUs
The furnace produces 80,000 BTUs of heating per hour
Energy efficiency ratings compare BTU output to electricity consumption

definitions: legendary winged dragon-like creature with two legs and a barbed tail from European mythology
examples: The medieval tapestry depicted a fierce wyvern guarding treasure
Knights in the story battled a wyvern terrorizing the village
The family crest features a golden wyvern on a blue field
Fantasy games often include wyverns as flying enemy creatures

definitions: colorless, odorless noble gas element used in specialized light sources and medical imaging
examples: Xenon headlights provide brighter illumination than traditional halogen bulbs
The MRI scanner uses xenon gas for lung imaging studies
Scientists discovered xenon in Earth's atmosphere in eighteen ninety-eight
Xenon arc lamps produce intense white light for film projectors

definitions: irrational fear or hatred of people from other countries or of things perceived as foreign
examples: Rising xenophobia led to discriminatory policies against immigrants
Educational programs help combat xenophobia in diverse communities
The politician's xenophobia alienated voters from immigrant backgrounds
Historical xenophobia resulted in exclusionary immigration laws

definitions: American corporation known for manufacturing photocopying machines and document technology
photocopy or duplicate made using a photocopying machine
examples: Xerox pioneered the development of modern photocopying technology
The company ordered new Xerox machines for every department
Please make a xerox of these documents for the meeting
The library charges ten cents per xerox page

definitions: vascular tissue in plants that transports water and nutrients from roots upward through the stem
examples: The xylem carries water from the roots to the leaves
Scientists studied xylem structure to understand drought resistance
Tree rings form from annual growth of xylem tissue
Damaged xylem prevents proper water transport in diseased plants

definitions: percussion instrument with wooden bars struck by mallets to produce musical notes
examples: The child learned to play simple melodies on the xylophone
The orchestra's xylophone added bright tones to the composition
Professional xylophones have bars made from rosewood or padauk
The xylophone part requires precise timing and coordination

definitions: large recreational boat or ship used for cruising or racing, typically privately owned
examples: The billionaire's yacht features a helipad and swimming pool
They chartered a yacht for their Mediterranean vacation
Racing yachts competed in the America's Cup competition
The marina accommodates yachts up to 200 feet long

definitions: sport or activity of racing or cruising in yachts
examples: Yachting requires understanding of wind patterns and navigation
The club offers yachting lessons for beginners every weekend
International yachting competitions attract skilled sailors worldwide
Monaco is famous for its yachting culture and prestigious regattas

definitions: person who owns or sails yachts, especially as a sport or pastime
examples: The experienced yachtsman navigated through the storm successfully
Several yachtsmen gathered at the harbor to discuss racing strategies
The yachtsman won three international sailing championships
Local yachtsmen volunteer to teach sailing to underprivileged youth

definitions: American technology company known for web services, search engine, and email
rude, uncouth, or rowdy person lacking refinement or manners
exclamation expressing excitement, triumph, or exuberance
examples: Yahoo was one of the internet's most popular websites in the nineties
She still uses her Yahoo email account for personal correspondence
The yahoos at the bar started a fight over the game
Don't act like a yahoo at the formal dinner tonight
Yahoo! We won the championship!
The crowd shouted yahoo when the home team scored

definitions: large domesticated ox with long shaggy hair native to Tibet and Central Asia
persistent idle talk or chatter about trivial matters
examples: Tibetan herders depend on yaks for milk, meat, and transportation
The yak's thick coat protects it from harsh mountain winters
They spent hours yakking about nothing important at the cafe
Stop yakking and let's get some work done

definitions: member of Japanese organized crime syndicates known for strict codes and elaborate tattoos
examples: The yakuza control various illegal businesses in major Japanese cities
Former yakuza members face discrimination when trying to rejoin society
The film depicts yakuza loyalty codes and ritual ceremonies
Police crackdowns reduced yakuza influence in legitimate businesses

definitions: starchy edible tuber of tropical climbing plants, important food crop in Africa and Asia
examples: She prepared candied yams for the Thanksgiving dinner
Farmers harvest yams after the vines begin dying back
Nigerian cuisine features yams in many traditional dishes
The market sells both white and purple yam varieties

definitions: active masculine principle in Chinese philosophy representing light, heat, and positive energy
examples: Yang complements yin to create balance in the universe
Traditional medicine seeks to balance yang and yin energies
The yang side of the symbol is white with a black dot
Excessive yang energy causes restlessness according to Chinese medicine

definitions: sharp, shrill bark typically made by small dogs
persistent annoying chatter or complaining
examples: The neighbor's terrier wouldn't stop yapping at passersby
A high-pitched yap came from the small dog behind the fence
She kept yapping about the restaurant service throughout dinner
His constant yap about work problems exhausted his friends

definitions: piece of ground adjoining a house used for outdoor activities
unit of linear measurement equal to three feet or 0.9144 meters
enclosed area used for specific work or storage purposes
examples: Children played soccer in the backyard after school
She planted tomatoes in the front yard garden
The fabric costs twenty dollars per yard
The football field measures one hundred yards long
The shipyard repairs commercial vessels and military ships
Railroad cars waited in the switching yard for sorting

definitions: distance or length measured in yards, especially in sports contexts
amount of fabric or material measured in yards
examples: The quarterback threw for 350 yards of passing yardage
Penalty yardage hurt the team's chances of winning
Calculate the yardage needed for making curtains for all windows
The fabric store offers discounts on large yardage purchases

definitions: measuring stick one yard long marked with subdivisions
standard or criterion used for comparison or judgment
examples: The carpenter used a yardstick to measure the wood planks
She kept a yardstick in the classroom for geometry lessons
Profit margins serve as the yardstick for business success
Academic performance shouldn't be the only yardstick for intelligence

definitions: continuous strand of twisted fibers used for knitting or weaving
long elaborate story, often exaggerated or fictitious
examples: She bought soft wool yarn for knitting winter scarves
The yarn tangled into knots in the basket
The sailor spun yarns about sea monsters and treasure
Grandfather's yarns about his youth entertained the children

definitions: rotation of aircraft or ship around vertical axis causing side-to-side movement
examples: Strong crosswinds caused the plane to yaw during landing
The ship's yaw made passengers feel seasick
The pilot corrected the yaw using the rudder controls
Excessive yaw can lead to loss of aircraft control
